alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 26 at 2:37PM AKST until January 28 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Blowing snow possible for Thompson Pass. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches possible. * WHERE...Northeast Prince William Sound. * WHEN...From Saturday evening through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A series of storms will track from the Gulf of Alaska north into Southcentral. The first storm will pass well to the east of the area tonight. Thus, the threat for heavy snow has been pushed back to Saturday evening as the second storm arrives. This storm still has potential to bring a period of heavy snow, though there is a high level of uncertainty in the track of this storm. Snow accumulation could end up being much lighter than the amounts above. Additional storm systems and potential for more snow will follow through early next week.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
